__comment_instructions: Copy this file, rename to {renderer-id}.json, fill in all required fields, remove all __comment_* keys, and run: python scripts/validate_data.py
__comment_id: URL-safe slug, lowercase, hyphens only. Must match filename (without .json). Examples: 'pbrt', 'mitsuba3', 'gaussian-splatting'
name: Your Renderer Name
__comment_name: Human-readable display name. Can include version qualifiers (e.g., 'PBRT v4', 'Mitsuba 3')
__comment_version: Latest known stable version string. Use renderer's own versioning. For no formal versioning, use '2024.01' or 'git-main'
description: One-sentence summary of the renderer (10-200 characters, no markdown, no newlines)
long_description:
2-3 paragraphs describing the renderer in full. Markdown is allowed.

Cover: what the renderer is, who built it, key technical differentiators, and its relationship to the broader ecosystem.

Write for an audience of researchers and engineers who are evaluating rendering tools. Be specific about technical capabilities rather than vague.
__comment_technique: One or more of: path_tracing, ray_tracing, rasterization, neural, gaussian_splatting, differentiable, volume_rendering, hybrid
__comment_language: Primary language first, then secondary. Examples: 'C++', 'Python/CUDA', 'C++/Python', 'Rust', 'JavaScript'
__comment_license: Use SPDX identifier: MIT, Apache-2.0, BSD-2-Clause, BSD-3-Clause, GPL-3.0, LGPL-2.1, AGPL-3.0. For custom: 'Custom (description)'
__comment_platforms: Allowed values: linux, macos, windows, web, android, ios
__comment_scene_formats: Input formats. Examples: pbrt, mitsuba_xml, gltf, glb, obj, fbx, usd, blend, collada, ply, stl, custom
__comment_output_formats: Output image formats. Examples: exr, hdr, png, jpg, tiff, bmp, ppm, webp
__comment_first_release: ISO 8601 date (YYYY-MM-DD). Use approximate date if exact date is unknown
__comment_status: One of: active, maintenance, inactive, archived, deprecated
__comment_tags: Lowercase, hyphens only. Examples: research, production, educational, physically-based, spectral, differentiable, mobile, real-time
strengths: Be specific and honest. Each item should be a complete sentence.
Focus on what makes this renderer genuinely stand out from alternatives.
Include at least 1, up to 7 items.
limitations: Be specific and honest. Each item should be a complete sentence.
Focus on real limitations a potential user should know about.
Include at least 1, up to 7 items.
best_for: One sentence describing the ideal use case for this renderer
__comment_optional_fields_below: All fields below are optional. Include them if you have the data.
not_ideal_for: One sentence describing poor-fit use cases
__comment_related: Array of renderer id values (slugs) for related or comparable renderers

features.__comment_features: Set each to true, false, or null (not applicable). See DATA_SCHEMA.md for the full list and descriptions.
